title: macbook 820 2879 PP18V5_DCIN_CONN move up and down ...
message: Move up and down? I need some voltages. Also measure resistance to GND on PPBUS_G3H.

title: macbook 820 2879 PP18V5_DCIN_CONN move up and down ...
macbook 820 2879 PP18V5_DCIN_CONN move up and down ...
message:
"2) 0.8v - 1.5v"
First check resistance to ground.
If bad, change U7000.
In any case, check D7005, R7005.

title: macbook 820 2879 PP18V5_DCIN_CONN move up and down ...
macbook 820 2879 PP18V5_DCIN_CONN move up and down ...
message: If D7005 and R7005 is good there should be adapter voltage on pin 2 not 0.8-1.5V! I suspect bad U7000 and R7005/D7005 at least.

title: macbook 820 2879 PP18V5_DCIN_CONN move up and down ...
macbook 820 2879 PP18V5_DCIN_CONN move up and down ...
message: Yes R7005 is dead. It is dead because U7000 is shorted. U7000 shorted because someone used a shit fake chinese charger. Replace R7005 and U7000. There may be more damage after that too.

title: macbook 820 2879 PP18V5_DCIN_CONN move up and down ...
message:
Measure resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28.
Replacing resistors will not repair a damaged trace...

title: macbook 820 2879 PP18V5_DCIN_CONN move up and down ...
message: You don't understand resistance? Please find some tutorial videos on how to use a multimeter and what resistance and voltage are. These topics are out of the scope of this forum, basic electronic knowledge is required.

title: macbook 820 2879 PP18V5_DCIN_CONN move up and down ...
message:
pin 17 = r7052: 0.2 ohm
pin 18 = r7051: 2.5 ohm
pin 27 = r7022: 10.2 ohm
pin 28 = r7021: 10.0 ohm
